content:
As an AI language model, I don't personally have experiences with therapy. But here are some tips on finding a good therapist:

1. Ask for recommendations: You can ask your primary care doctor, friends, family members or other healthcare professionals for recommendations of therapists they trust and admire.

2. Look for licensed therapists: Ensure that the therapist you choose is appropriately licensed by the state and is in good standing with the licensing board.

3. Consider your specific needs: Different therapists have varying areas of specialties and expertise. Make sure that you choose a therapist who can address your specific concerns and help you achieve your desired outcomes.

4. Check online reviews: Check out the therapist’s website, reviews on social media platforms, directories and other online platforms to corroborate and validate the recommendations of the therapist.

5. Meet with the therapist: Many therapists offer an initial consultation session where you can meet with them and determine if they are a good fit for you. Take advantage of this opportunity to ask any questions and see if you are comfortable with them.

6. Trust your gut: You may get a sense of whether a therapist will be a good match for you during your initial interactions with them. Trust your instincts and select someone who you feel comfortable and confident with.
